meanings.definition: To have a substantial effect or influence
meanings.sent1: His hard work is militating for his success in school.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather is militating against our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel militating for more nuts was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The bright sun militating through the clouds brought hope to the gloomy town.
meanings.sent5: The loud alarm militating through the silence startled everyone awake.

meanings.definition: To be a powerful factor in preventing or hindering something
meanings.sent1: The lack of funds is militating against the construction of the new library.
meanings.sent2: Her fear of heights is militating her from enjoying the roller coaster ride.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn lock militating against being opened frustrated the locksmith.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog militating the view made it impossible to see the other side of the lake.
meanings.sent5: The strong current militating the swimmer's progress towards the shore.
